page.title: 15GARDEN CENTRES, SOUTHWELL
page.content: The two main{garden centres}are Merryweathers and Taylors. Merryweathers is situated in Southwell on the Mansfield road. It cultivates 292 different types of shrubs and climbing plants, costing from Â£1.75 to Â£1O.95, as well as many fruit trees and bushes. It also sells garden and building accessories, books, crat items etc. In the 19th Century, the{Bramley apple}was cultivated here. Taylors nursery is situated at Normanton. It is slightly larger. They specialize in rose bushes and bedding plants, as well as carrying large stocks of paving stones, walling materials and garden furniture. A speciality of the centre is ornamental cold water fish.{Gardening}is a popular{hobby}around Southwell and the centres are often crowded.
